joke: You ever crack an egg and it cracks you up first? Same. Those yolks slap.
I used to play piano by ear—neighbors begged me to try hands. Big improvement.
My scarecrow buddy just won an award. Honestly, he’s outstanding in his field.
Got a construction joke brewing, but uh… still under renovation. Hard hats on.
Seen skeletons throw hands? Exactly. No guts, no glory.
I know 25 letters of the alphabet. That missing ‘y’ keeps me up at night.
Math book walked in looking stressed—too many problems, not enough solutions.
Picked up a book on anti‑gravity. Can’t put it down. Like, physically.
My bike tipped over. Doctor says it’s two‑tired. I say it needs a vacation.
Kicked my soap habit. Clean now. Friends say I’m a little too squeaky.
If your nose was 12 inches long, that’s a foot. Congrats? Condolences?
I don’t trust stairs. One minute you’re up, next you’re down—they’re plotting.
Ordered spaghetti, got fake noodles. Chef said it’s an impasta. I left a saucy review.
Golfer packed two pairs of pants—just in case he nailed a hole‑in‑one. Respect the prep.
Penguin home improvement tip: they just igloo it together. No contractor needed.
Tomato saw the salad dressing and turned red. I’d blush too, honestly.
That cheese? Not yours. Nacho cheese. Them’s the dairy rules.
Professor went off on a tangent. Class circled back an hour later.
Asked an oyster to share—nope. Shellfish behavior, classic.
Factory makes okay stuff. Not great, not bad. A real satisfactory.
